column4: hey, is it normaly that i have lots of processes with same name, like i have 2 xchat processes and 2 trackerd processes, etc ...
only if you have multiple users logged in
no, i'm the oinly one log into the computer
do a ps -ef|grep xchat     see when one was started, and kill them if you want
is it possible that i have logged in 2x with the same user name
might be, don't think so though, you can also do a pstree to see if it's using a different session
if i try who command, i have 4 it gives my 4x times username, with the same name but the second column goes like this. tty1, tty7, pts/0, pts/1
you can hit ctrl alt f1 to log into tty1 and ctrl alt f7 to log back
hm, is it possibly that i loged 4 times with kubanc, because i always do ctrl+alt+backspace to restart x-server,  to clean the swap memory and then log again with the same username
it's possible to run multiple x servers at the same time, go through all your terminals and close them out if there are
i only have one teminal opened, and that is terminator. the x servers are ok. tty1 is for terminal widnow, and the tty7 is the x-server window
but what is pts/0 and pts/1
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudo_terminal
i opened the link you gave my and now i have 13 processes with name homt/username/http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudo_terminal
can you pastebin a ps -ef
sory the name is  homteusername/"path to firefox-bin application"/http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudo_terminal
http://paste.ubuntu.com/326958/
everything looks fine except for the copy fo firefox that's opening everything in a new instance
could it be something with that: i installed firefox, and it works ok, but something went wrong ...
any reason to not use the one from the repos?
i'm using ubuntu 8.04, that came with firefox 3.0, so i tried to install firefox 3.5 by extracting the folder and then running the ./firefox file
maybe this is the problem
